item.title: Dark Philly Adult Night Tour
item.description: See the dark side of Philly during this adult night tour developed by a local university professor. Not for the faint of heart, this tour uncovers Philadelphia’s R-rated sites and stories, from vampires, pirate ghost ships, and haunted attractions to torture, executions, and the red light district. You'll also visit historical attractions and see the sights illuminated at night. This tour is not suitable for children.

image.alt: Dark Philly Adult Night Tour

item.title: 2-Hour Gettysburg Battlefield Guided History Bus Tour with a National Park Guide
item.description: Visit sites from the Battle of Gettysburg on a bus tour with a guide who tells you about the phases of the 3-day battle, which was a turning point in the American Civil War. See Devil's Den, Little Round Top, the location of Pickett's charge and more. If you're a history or war buff, don't miss this chance to learn about a pivotal piece of the United States' past.

image.alt: 2-Hour Gettysburg Battlefield Guided History Bus Tour with a National Park Guide

item.title: Revolution and the Founders: History Tour of Philadelphia
item.description: Discover the history and flavors of Philadelphia on a walking tour through the city. Follow your guide, who has a degree in history, to the Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, and other noteworthy sights in America's Birthplace of Independence. Get to see some of the favorite haunts of the country’s founding fathers and other influential Americans.

image.alt: Revolution and the Founders: History Tour of Philadelphia

item.title: Philadelphia Old City Historic Walking Tour with 10+ Top Sites
item.description: Get more from a visit to Philly and walk in the footsteps of America's Founding Fathers on this walking tour of Philadelphia's old city. Visit important landmarks such as Christ Church, the Ben Franklin Post Office, Carpenters' Hall, and Independence Hall as your guide narrates local history. This walking tour is ideal for history buffs or first-time visitors trying to get their bearings in a new city.

image.alt: Philadelphia Old City Historic Walking Tour with 10+ Top Sites

item.title: Premium Amish Country Tour including Amish Farm and House
item.description: Immerse yourself in the customs and traditions of Amish country during this 3-part tour. Explore a farmhouse dating from 1805 where you will listen to narrative on the customs, culture, and traditions of the Amish. In a minibus, enjoy a scenic ride through the Amish countryside, complete with photo ops. Then take a self-guided tour through an historic farmstead that includes a schoolhouse, a craft market, and a variety of farm animals.

image.alt: Premium Amish Country Tour including Amish Farm and House

item.title: The Constitutional Walking Tour of Philadelphia
item.description: Discover the birthplace of America on this guided walking tour through the country’s most historic area in Philadelphia. Get a behind-the-scenes look at the Independence National Historical Park and more than 20 other historic sites on this 1.25-mile trek, including the National Constitution Center, Independence Hall, the Liberty Bell Center, and many more.

image.alt: The Constitutional Walking Tour of Philadelphia

item.title: Old City Philadelphia History Tour with Washington Tent Show
item.description: Take a deep dive into Philadelphia history on this guided walking tour of the city’s Revolutionary landmarks. With a full roster of historical sites like Independence Hall as well newer institutions such as the Museum of the American Revolution, this tour combines all the essentials for a keen understanding of Philly’s crucial role in the founding of the United States.

image.alt: Old City Philadelphia History Tour with Washington Tent Show

item.title: BYOB Historically Hilarious Trolley Tour of Philadelphia
item.description: See Philadelphia’s historic landmarks and sites while sipping your own beer or wine and hearing little-known facts from a guide. This sightseeing tour by trolley takes the stress off finding a designated driver for exploring as you see tops sights such City Hall, Love Park, Boathouse Row, the Liberty Bell, Betsy Ross’ House, and the Declaration House. Drinks are BYOB.

image.alt: BYOB Historically Hilarious Trolley Tour of Philadelphia

item.title: Amish Experience SuperSaver Package
item.description: No trip to Lancaster County is complete without learning about the Amish communities that call this part of Pennsylvania home. This tour provides incredible value by combining three top Amish experiences into a single booking: tour Amish farmlands in a 14-passenger shuttle, watch a theater performance that tells the story of an Amish family, and take a guided walking tour of a replica Amish house and school.

image.alt: Amish Experience SuperSaver Package

item.title: Philadelphia 2 Hour Electric Cart Tour
item.description: Experience Philadelphia like never before on our two-hour electric cart tour! Guided by a local expert, explore Old City’s historic sites like Independence Hall, the Liberty Bell, and Elfreth's Alley. Pass through Center City, admire City Hall, and visit the iconic steps of the Philadelphia Museum of Art. Enjoy the lively atmosphere of Chinatown, South Street, and the mosaic wonder of Philly’s Magic Gardens. Join us for a memorable journey filled with history, culture, and the vibrant spirit of this dynamic city!

image.alt: Philadelphia 2 Hour Electric Cart Tour

item.title: Gettysburg: Ghost Hunt Tour with Ghost Hunting Equipment
item.description: Gettysburg is the site of the Civil War’s bloodiest battle—and many claim that the town is still haunted by the legacy of that conflict. See a new side of the area when you explore late at night, and learn all about local ghost stories and frights, on this eerie walking tour. After a historical overview, your group will grab ghost-hunting gear to see what frights you turn up.

image.alt: Gettysburg: Ghost Hunt Tour with Ghost Hunting Equipment

item.title: Center City Philadelphia Food Tour with Reading Market
item.description: Philadelphia is a terrific foodie city, but, for visitors, it can be tricky to know where to find the best places to eat. This walking tour removes the guesswork. In a small group of no more than 12, you'll eat your way through the city, from Reading Terminal Market to Sansom Street, and experience the best of the Philly food scene.

image.alt: Center City Philadelphia Food Tour with Reading Market

item.title: Essential Pittsburgh Experience - The One Tour to Take
item.description: Enjoy a private introduction to downtown Pittsburgh on this guided tour in and around the ‘Steel City.’ Begin with a trip to the top of Mount Washington via the iconic Duquesne Incline for a stellar, bird’s-eye view of Pittsburgh and the surrounding area. Then explore the popular North Shore, home to football’s Steelers, baseball’s Pirates and a variety of entertainment venues. Finally, cross the Allegany River toward downtown to see Pittsburgh’s Cultural District as well as the neighborhood of Oakland, home to the University of Pittsburgh. Hotel pickup and drop-off included.

image.alt: Essential Pittsburgh Experience - The One Tour to Take

item.title: Echoes of War All Ages Ghost Tour
item.description: Learn more about the Battle of Gettysburg and the lives lost during one of the Civil War’s fiercest fights with this ghost tour that takes you to the most haunted locations in town. Hear stories about the soldiers who died here—and whose souls may still walk these streets—and about the locals who watched their town destroyed by war. Gain a better understanding of this important historic battle through engaging ghost stories suitable for all ages.

image.alt: Echoes of War All Ages Ghost Tour

item.title: Flavors of Philly Food Tour
item.description: Bypass the overpriced tourist restaurants with lackluster food and eat your way through Philadelphia like a local on a 2.5-hour culinary walking tour. Follow your guide to the heart of the city and visit five distinctive eateries to sample iconic Philly favorites, such as cheesesteak, tomato pie, and soft pretzels. Make sure to save room for not one but two desserts at the Reading Terminal Market.

image.alt: Flavors of Philly Food Tour

item.title: True Crime Philadelphia and History Tour
item.description: Uncover Philadelphia’s dark past, and visit some of its most famous landmarks besides, on this macabre, small-group walking tour of Center City. Meet your guide (a college professor or trained historian), and set off to sights ranging from Betsy Ross House and Elfreth’s Alley to Christ Church and beyond. As you go, listen to ghost stories, legends about famous serial killers, and other spooky tales.

image.alt: True Crime Philadelphia and History Tour

item.title: Unique Amish Immersion in Lancaster
item.description: Learn all about Amish culture, traditions, and history—and immerse yourself in an Amish community in Lancaster, Pennsylvania—on this in-depth, small-group tour. Pick between morning and afternoon tour times and meet your guide in Lancaster. You’ll visit a working farm and will meet a local Amish family, will drive through miles of scenic countryside, will visit an Amish-owned creamery for ice cream, and much more.

image.alt: Unique Amish Immersion in Lancaster

item.title: Lower Yough Pennsylvania Classic White Water Tour
item.description: Go rafting on the Lower Yough for a thrilling outdoors experience in Ohiopyle. Located about one hour south of Pittsburgh, Ohiopyle State Park is home to the Youghiogheny River, which has class 2-4 rapids on this 7.5-mile (12-km) trip. Your guide shares instruction on paddling and provides all the necessary gear.

image.alt: Lower Yough Pennsylvania Classic White Water Tour

item.title: Inside the Italian Market: Chef-Led Tasting Journey
item.description: Few Philadelphia neighborhoods can rival the Italian Market when it comes to culinary heritage—and on this small-group tour, visit a number of the area’s most delicious highlights. In the company of your chef guide, venture to a beloved local cheese shop, a Mexican tortilla maker, a classic South Philadelphia pizzeria, and more, enjoying generous samples and shopping discounts along the way.

image.alt: Inside the Italian Market: Chef-Led Tasting Journey

item.title: A Day Trip to Amish Country from Philadelphia
item.description: Discover one of Pennsylvania’s most distinctive regions and communities on this full-day, small-group tour of Lancaster County’s Amish Country. In the morning, meet your guide in Center City Philadelphia and travel via air-conditioned vehicle. You’ll learn all about the region’s Amish history, will see working farmers and visit the Amish Village Museum, can shop for Amish goods from pies to quilts, and otherwise discover this region’s unique heritage.

image.alt: A Day Trip to Amish Country from Philadelphia

item.title: Authentic Tour & Meal with the Amish!
item.description: Learn about Amish culture in Pennsylvania's Lancaster County on this tour and dining experience. You'll explore the countryside to see historical landmarks and then meet a local Amish family for a sit-down home-cooked meal, where you'll have the chance to observe their way of life on a farm. The tour is designed by a local resident who grew up as a Mennonite outside Strasburg, PA, and whose father was born Amish. Times and dates may be subject to change due to scheduling with the families.

image.alt: Authentic Tour & Meal with the Amish!

item.title: Classic Philadelphia City Bike Tour
item.description: Explore Philadelphia on a bicycle with a 3.5-hour tour of the city’s most beloved sites. Pedal alongside your guide as you loop through the city, and pause to take in the Philadelphia Museum of Art before riding a scenic river trail to Rittenhouse Park. Learn about Philly history and culture at Washington Square Park, the Liberty Bell and Independence Hall, and enjoy a pace and route that’s tailored to your group’s needs. This small-group tour ensures a personal experience, and offers a fun, active way to visit Philly’s essential highlights.

image.alt: Classic Philadelphia City Bike Tour

item.title: Best of the Burgh Walking Tour of Pittsburgh
item.description: Join us in this urban adventure where we'll show you some memorable sites, accompanied by a great narrative that will give you a profound understanding of this city. Learn all about the outstanding architecture, fascinating history, the lives of former titans of industry as well as fun hidden public art pieces of the Steel City. Get to see the main sites but also discover gems off the beaten paths. - Our tour guides are locals who truly love their city, they are very knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile for you if you are particularly interested in something. Groups are kept small to provide a personal experience. Kids and dogs are welcome as well!

image.alt: Best of the Burgh Walking Tour of Pittsburgh

item.title: Half Day Driving Tour of Valley Forge National Park
item.description: Valley Forge National Historical Park is one of the country’s most important Revolutionary War landmarks—and this tour makes exploring easy. In the morning, meet your guide in Philadelphia, hop aboard your comfortable vehicle, and set off with just a small group for company. You’ll follow in the footsteps of the Continental Army, will see Washington’s Headquarters, will admire the National Memorial Arch, and much more.

image.alt: Half Day Driving Tour of Valley Forge National Park
